content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?> <!-- generator="FeedCreator 1.7.2" --> <rdf:RDF     xmlns="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/"     xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#"     xmlns:slash="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/slash/"     xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">     <channel rdf:about="http://www.europeana-photography.eu/feed.php">         <title>EuropeanaPhotography Project</title>         <description>EuropeanaPhotography Project</description>         <link>http://www.europeana-photography.eu/</link>        <dc:date>2015-03-12T09:22:02+01:00</dc:date>         <items>             <rdf:Seq>                 <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.europeana-photography.eu/go/en/90/news-archive/93/all-our-yesterdays-goes-belgian"/>                 <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.europeana-photography.eu/go/en/91/events-archive/57/all-our-yesterdays"/>                 <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.europeana-photography.eu/go/en/91/events-archive/53/the-digitization-age-mass-culture-is-quality-culture-challenges-for-cultural-heritage-and-society"/>             </rdf:Seq>         </items>     </channel>     <item rdf:about="http://www.europeana-photography.eu/go/en/90/news-archive/93/all-our-yesterdays-goes-belgian">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:source>http://www.europeana-photography.eu/</dc:source>         <title>All Our Yesterdays goes Belgian!</title>         <link>http://www.europeana-photography.eu/go/en/90/news-archive/93/all-our-yesterdays-goes-belgian</link>         <description><p>From <strong>1 February to 15 March 2015</strong>, the EuropeanaPhotography expo <strong><em>All Our Yesterdays (1839 &ndash; 1939). Life through the lens of Europe&rsquo;s first photographers</em></strong> will be visiting Belgium&rsquo;s Campus Library Arenberg - Heverlee and Tweebronnen Library - Leuven.</p> <p>While, for the greater part, this exhibition will re-produce the first run of <em>All Our Yesterdays </em>in Pisa, its Belgian flavor will be enhanced by including photographs from the Leuven City Archives. The opening of the exhibition coincides with the ultimate days of EuropeanaPhotography&rsquo;s project term. Therefore, a project plenary as well as a scientific conference have been aligned with its vernissage.</p> <p>More information on the conference, devoted to <strong><em>The Impact of Digitization on Photographic Heritage: Memories Reframed </em>(29-30 January 2015, Heverlee/Leuven)</strong><em>,</em> and the exhibition on <strong><a href="http://allouryesterdays.be" title="link to external website">allouryesterdays.be</a></strong>!</p></description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.europeana-photography.eu/go/en/91/events-archive/57/all-our-yesterdays">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2015-02-01T00:00:00+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:source>http://www.europeana-photography.eu/</dc:source>         <title>All Our Yesterdays</title>         <link>http://www.europeana-photography.eu/go/en/91/events-archive/57/all-our-yesterdays</link>         <description><p>The exhibition "All our Yesterdays" showcases masterpieces&nbsp;from the first 100 years of photography&nbsp;(1839-1939) from the most famous European collections of in total 19 partner institutions, both photo-archives, photo-agencies and&nbsp;museums. The collections can be viewed online at&nbsp;<a href="http://www.europeana.eu/portal/search.html?query=*:*&amp;qf=PROVIDER:EuropeanaPhotography">Europeana.</a></p> <p>Themes are based on the concept&nbsp;"the City Lives". The exhibition portrays the life of our ancestors in Europe, from London to&nbsp;Cyprus, from&nbsp;Barcelona&nbsp;to&nbsp;Kiev.&nbsp;</p> <p>All photos were digitised with&nbsp;state-of-the-art technology, and printed to very high quality standards. In the exhibition realia will be shown as well from the collections of the Fotomuseum Antwerp.&nbsp;</p> <p>"All our Yesterdays" started as an exhibition in Pisa in Spring 2014, and now travels throughout Europe to bring Europeana closer to the citizens. In Leuven, the exhibition will have&nbsp;a local dimension as it will include&nbsp;collections of the Leuven City Archive. Leuven's history is forever intertwined with the European desitiny since the Great Fire in 1914.&nbsp;</p> <p>Entrance to the exhibition is free; guided tours are available on request.&nbsp;</p> <p>more info: early.photography@ kuleuven.be&nbsp;</p> <p>The exhibition will be inaugurated at the&nbsp;EuropeanaPhotography Final Conference.</p></description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.europeana-photography.eu/go/en/91/events-archive/53/the-digitization-age-mass-culture-is-quality-culture-challenges-for-cultural-heritage-and-society">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-11-03T00:00:00+01:00</dc:date>         <dc:source>http://www.europeana-photography.eu/</dc:source>         <title>The Digitization Age: Mass Culture is Quality Culture. Challenges for Cultural Heritage and Society</title>         <link>http://www.europeana-photography.eu/go/en/91/events-archive/53/the-digitization-age-mass-culture-is-quality-culture-challenges-for-cultural-heritage-and-society</link>         <description><p>A panel workshop&nbsp;<strong>to disseminate the latest achievements and to foster collaboration in the digital cultural heritage sector</strong>&nbsp;is organized in the framework of the important congress&nbsp;<a href="http://www.culturalheritage2014.eu/" title="link to external website">Euromed 2014</a>. EU projects, organizations and professional operating in this field are invited to participate in the discussion.</p> <p>The amount of digitized cultural heritage in Europe continues to grow: the digitization activities have a positive impact on the society, by making the cultural heritage more accessible for the citizens, and by generating benefits to the content owners. Several questions arise about digitized cultural heritage:&nbsp;<strong>how can digital cultural data be re-used at best, what is the impact on society, and how to preserve it in the long term?</strong>&nbsp;This panel discussion will try to answer these questions, and<strong>&nbsp;to present the latest EU projects that wish to identify a strategy for the cultural heritage in the new digital age.</strong></p></description>     </item> </rdf:RDF>
